title.narrative: IR 3. LES PROGR. EDUCAT AVEC PLUS EQUITÉ

description.narrative: By 2015, The education programs provide greater equity, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2015, (i) the primary school Gross Enrolment Rate (GER) increases from 72.4% in 2008-2009 to 100%, with a special focus on vulnerable children and those with special needs and (ii) the primary school Completion Rate (CR) increases from 45.9% in 2009-2010 to 75.1%, with special focus on girls.

title.narrative: By 2015, The education programs provide greater equity

description.narrative: Gender equity saw a slow but steady improvement with persisting geographic disparities. The promotion of the national inclusive education strategy is ongoing, supporting 4,493 children with disabilities, and alternative education for over 2,640 OOSC. To continue their education, 1,103 girls benefited of scholarships. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/03/2018
